death.railcraft.bore.1: %s got in the way of progress
death.railcraft.bore.4: %s a pensé qu'il pouvait faire mieux que John Henry
death.railcraft.bore.5: %s got stuck between a rock and a hard place
death.railcraft.bore.6: %s was on the wrong side of progress
death.railcraft.crusher.2: %s is not the man of steel, they crush just like the rest of us
death.railcraft.crusher.3: %s stared into the abyss, then they slipped
death.railcraft.crusher.4: %s is going to need to replace their stuff
death.railcraft.electric.1: %s is saying hello to Nikola Tesla
death.railcraft.electric.3: %s was enlightened to wonders of electrification
death.railcraft.electric.4: %s should have read the warning label
death.railcraft.electric.6: %s learned something about electricity, IT HURTS!
death.railcraft.steam.2: %s is not immune to high temperatures, despite claims to the contrary
death.railcraft.steam.3: %s discovered how painful Steam can be
death.railcraft.steam.6: %s discovered that Steam baths are best left to saunas
death.railcraft.track_electric.3: %s was enlightened to wonders of electrification
death.railcraft.track_electric.4: %s a trébuché sur le troisième rail
death.railcraft.track_electric.6: %s learned something about electricity, IT HURTS!
death.railcraft.train.1: %s s'est fait écraser par un train
death.railcraft.train.3: %s played chicken with a train; the train won
death.railcraft.train.5: %s bought a one-way ticket to the afterlife
death.railcraft.train.6: %s aurait dû porter ses bleus de travail
enchantment.railcraft.destruction.desc: Deconstructs blocks in a wider area.
enchantment.railcraft.smack.desc: Increases the boost applied to trains.
jei.railcraft.desc.block_signal: C'est le signal basique utilisé pour la détection des wagonnets. --incomplete--.
jei.railcraft.desc.disposable_battery: A battery designed to work with the charge network. Good for cheap, single use storage. Comes fully charged.
jei.railcraft.desc.disposable_battery_em: A battery designed to work with the charge network. Good for cheap, single use storage. This one is empty and can be recycled in the Crusher.
jei.railcraft.desc.distant_signal: This type of signal is primarily intended for cosmetic usage. It doesn't interface with carts at all and simply displays the aspect sent to it from a paired Controller.
jei.railcraft.desc.dual_block_signal: This signal contains a standard Block Signal on the upper lamp and a Distant Signal on the lower. It is both a Controller and a Receiver.
jei.railcraft.desc.dual_distant_signal: This signal contains two Distant Signals. They can be paired to different Controllers.
jei.railcraft.desc.dual_token_signal: This signal a Token Signal on the upper lamp and Distant Signal on the lower. It is both a Controller and a Receiver.
jei.railcraft.desc.feed_station: Allows you to feed nearby animals automatically. Can be disabled with Redstone. Will stop feeding if there are too many animals nearby to prevent over-population.
jei.railcraft.desc.logbook: The Logbook records any player that passes within a 16 blocks radius of the block and the day they visited. It can only be broken by the owner.
jei.railcraft.desc.manual_rolling_machin: Machine for rolling various shapes of metal. If there is only enough items in the grid for one cycle, you can click the output display to force crafting.
jei.railcraft.desc.nickel_iron_battery: A battery designed to work with the charge network. Good for general purpose usage.
jei.railcraft.desc.nickel_zinc_battery: A battery designed to work with the charge network. Good for low draw, long term storage.
jei.railcraft.desc.powered_rolling_machi: Machine for rolling various shapes of metal. Can be automated by simply piping items in and out. If there is only enough items in the grid for one cycle, you can click the output display to force crafting.
jei.railcraft.desc.token_signal: This signal can be used to define an area to monitor for carts entering and leaving. It pairs into a net of signals, with no particular limit to the number of signals defining the area. Recommended for junctions and diagonals. It will send the resulting aspect to a paired Receiver.
jei.railcraft.desc.tunnel_bore: Machine designed for digging tunnels and laying track.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.1: The Routing Table when placed in a Routing Detector or Switch will define a set of rules that are used to match against any passing Locomotive. These rules are define using a simple logic syntax that allows you to create rules as simple or complex as you like. The syntax is a Prefix Notation script, the Operators are followed by the Operands. Only one keyword is allowed per line. If no Operator is specified, OR is assumed. Routing Tables can be copied by placing two or more in a crafting grid.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.10:
Result:
  The script on the previous page will
  match a Locomotive with a destination
  of "TheFarLands/Milliways",
  or that is painted black and red,
  or that has a destination of
  "SecretHideout/OceanEntrance",
  but only if its not owned by Steve.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.11:
Regular Expressions:
  Some Conditions support
  Regular Expressions.
  To use a regex, add a '?' before the '='.
  Rules are standard Java Patterns.
Supporting Conditions:
  Dest, Name
Example:
  Dest?=.*Hill
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.12:
Analog Output:
  IF can be used with integer constants
  for analog output. Ints and IF can
  only be used at top level, or as
  then or else to IF. TRUE and FALSE
  are usable anywhere.
Example:
  IF
  Dest=Town
  8
  IF
  Dest=City
  4
  FALSE
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.2:
Operator Keywords:
  AND - Two Operands, both must be true.
  OR - Two Operands, one must be true.
  NOT - Invert the following Operand.
  IF - Three Operands: cond, then, else.
       If cond is true, use then;
       otherwise, use else.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.3:
Condition Keywords:
  Dest=<string>
    If the Locomotive's Destination
    string starts with this string,
    the condition is true.
    "Dest=null" will match carts
    with no destination.
  Owner=<username>
    True if the Locomotive belongs
    to this person.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.4:
Condition Keywords:
  Name=<entityname>
    True if it matches the
    Minecart's name.
    "Name=null" will match carts
    with no custom name.
  Type=<modid:itemname>
    True if it matches the
    Minecart's item name.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.5:
Condition Keywords:
  Rider=<type>[:<qualifier>]
    True if the Train contains
        a matching passenger
        Simple Types:
          any, none, mob, animal, unnamed
        Qualifier Capable Types:
          player, named, entity
        Regex Capable Types:
          player, named
        See GitHub Issue #844 for examples
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.6:
Condition Keywords:
  Color=<primary>,<secondary>
    True if the Locomotive's primary
    and secondary colors match.
    Accepts "Any" as a wildcard.
    Colors: Black, Red, Green, Brown, Blue,
    Purple, Cyan, LightGray, Gray, Pink, Lime,
    Yellow, LightBlue, Magenta, Orange, White
  NeedsRefuel=<true/false>
    If the Locomotive is low on Fuel
    or Water this will divert it.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.7:
Condition Keywords:
  Redstone=<true/false>
    True if the Routing Block
    is being powered by Redstone.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.8:
Condition Keywords:
  Loco=<string>
    True if locomotive matches
    parameter string.
    Accepted strings: electric, steam,
    creative, none.
    Using parameter none will only return
    true if there is no locomotive.
manual.railcraft.routing_table.page.9:
Example Script:
  Dest=TheFarLands
  Color=Black,Red
  AND
  NOT
  Owner=Steve
  Dest=SecretHideout/OceanEntrance
This signal box is locked to %s. It can only be modified by them or an operator.
Click to lock signal box. Once locked, it will only be modifiable by you or an operator
screen.railcraft.golden_ticket.help: Le Billet d'or est un billet à usage illimité qui peut être utilisé pour monter tout train public ou train appartenant à l'émetteur. Il peut également être combiné avec du papier pour produire des billets à usage unique.
screen.railcraft.golden_ticket.title: Billet d'or
screen.railcraft.locomotive.lock.locked: This cart is locked to %s. It will only accept tickets issued by them or an operator.
screen.railcraft.locomotive.lock.private: This cart is private to %s. It can only be controlled by them or an operator.
screen.railcraft.locomotive.lock.unlocke: Click to lock locomotive. Once locked, it will only accept tickets issued by you or an operator.
screen.railcraft.locomotive.steam.mode.d: Locomotive reduces fuel usage, but retains its heat. If the train is held by a track, it behaves as if idle.
Éteint la locomotive. Arrête tout mouvement et commence le processus de refroidir.
screen.railcraft.name: Name
screen.railcraft.switch_track_router.pri: Will only route locomotive that belong to %s
screen.railcraft.tunnel_bore.head: Head
Start timer when the last input signal turns off.
signal.railcraft.capacitor.rising_edge.d: Start timer as soon as the input signal is received.
tips.railcraft.abandoned_track: Can be suspended over gaps in terrain
tips.railcraft.apply_redstone_to_dispens: - Appliquer la redstone pour distribuer des wagonnets -
tips.railcraft.booster_track: Applies a boost force to the cart
tips.railcraft.cannot_make_corners_high_: Cannot make corners at High Speed
tips.railcraft.cart.maintenance.mode.off: While Off, will not perform maintenance functions and will have higher max speed
tips.railcraft.cart.maintenance.mode.on: While On, will actively perform maintenance functions
tips.railcraft.cart_dispenser: Distribuer des wagonnets sur les voies
tips.railcraft.comparator_output_from_ca: - Can be used to get Comparator output from carts -
tips.railcraft.control_track: Applies a small force to the cart
tips.railcraft.crowbar.desc: Right-click while sneaking to link carts.
tips.railcraft.crowbar.link.started: A commencé à attacher des wagonnets
tips.railcraft.detector_track: Emits Redstone when a cart passes in the indicated direction
tips.railcraft.disembarking_track: Dismount riding entities in direction of arrow
tips.railcraft.dumping_track: Drops entities or items through the track
tips.railcraft.firestone.charged: Filled with energy, you only need to exert your will onto it to release it's blistering heat...
tips.railcraft.firestone.cut: Still its energies rage out of control...
tips.railcraft.firestone.empty: Its energies controlled, it could be useful if you could recharge it...
tips.railcraft.firestone.ore: It lies in the lava beds in the nether
tips.railcraft.firestone.raw: It quickens in your hands, you can feel it in the very air around you...
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_det: - Hit with Crowbar to change detection direction -
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_dir: - Hit with Crowbar to change direction -
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_for: - Hit with Crowbar to change force -
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_mod: - Hit with Crowbar to change mode -
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_ran: - Hit with Crowbar to change range -
tips.railcraft.hit_crowbar_to_change_tic: - Hit with Crowbar to change ticket -
tips.railcraft.locomotive.item.whistle: Il n'y a pas actuellement de sifflet installé.
tips.railcraft.manipulator.redstone_mode: Process until out of room or supply.
Process until out of room or supply, but keep pristine carts.
tips.railcraft.manipulator.transfer_mode: Move until the source matches the filter.
Move until the destination matches the filter.
Move exactly as much as is in the filter.
tips.railcraft.one_way_track: Carts can only pass in the direction of the arrow
tips.railcraft.overalls: Protection against the dangers of track-working
tips.railcraft.reinforced_track: 125% of the speed of normal track
tips.railcraft.rolling_machine: Crafting bench for various metal items
tips.railcraft.routing_track: Régler le billet d'une locomotive passante
tips.railcraft.signal_interlock_box: Permits only one aspect signal to pass
tips.railcraft.signal_label.desc2: Right click while sneaking to name a signal or signal box
tips.railcraft.spike_maul: Converts track to switches and junctions.
tips.railcraft.strap_iron_track: 30% of the speed of iron track
tips.railcraft.throttle_track: Adjusts the speed of passing locomotive
tips.railcraft.track_undercutter: Replaces the blocks under the track
tips.railcraft.whistle_track: Passing locomotives will blow their whistle
